About.title: Your Technical Co-Founder. On Demand.
About.p1_1: You've built companies before. You don't need hand-holding. You need a
About.p2: I've spent 20 years building products, leading engineering teams, and founding companies. Two exits. One still going. Now I help experienced founders get their technical foundation right — so they can move fast without the regret of rebuilding everything in 18 months.

Services.title: 20+ Years Building, Shipping, and Scaling
Services.p: I've been on both sides — as a founder who needed help, and as the person founders call when things need to work. Architecture, team building, technical strategy. The stuff that's hard to get right without experience.
Services.product_dev_p: You've validated the idea. Now you need to build it properly. I design the technical foundation — stack, infrastructure, team structure — so it scales with you, not against you.
Services.tech_audit_p1: Raising a round? Acquiring a company? I provide honest, investor-ready technical assessments.
Services.tech_audit_p2: No fluff. Just what's working, what's not, and what it'll take to fix.
Services.digital_strategy_p1: Sometimes you just need someone who can build.
Services.digital_strategy_p2: I go deep when needed — backend systems, integrations, infrastructure — especially in early stages where every decision compounds.
Services.ai_p: Need ongoing technical leadership without a full-time hire? I embed with your team, set direction, unblock engineers, and keep the product moving.

Process.title: How I Work
Process.subtitle: No 47-page proposals. No endless discovery phases. Here's what working together looks like:

step1.label: Week 1
step1.title: We talk
step1.desc: 30-minute call. You tell me what you're building and where you're stuck. I tell you honestly if I can help. No pitch decks required.

step2.label: Week 2
step2.title: I dig in
step2.desc: If we're a fit, I spend time understanding your codebase, team, and constraints. I come back with a clear assessment and recommendations.

step3.label: Ongoing
step3.title: We build
step3.desc: Depending on what you need: I might design your architecture, lead your team, write code, or do all three. Flexible engagement — scale up or down as needed.

step4.label: Always
step4.title: I stay available
step4.desc: Even after the main engagement, I'm a Slack message away. The best technical partners are the ones who stick around.

Testimonials.title: What Founders Say
Testimonials.subtitle: I've worked with experienced operators who know the difference between good technical advice and hand-waving.

detlev.quote: Robert was the technical backbone of Parkling. While I focused on the business side, he built the entire data platform from scratch. When BMW and Daimler came knocking, the technology wasn't just ready — it was exactly what they needed. That's rare.

bjarte.quote: We built Suria Labs together from zero to 30 people. Robert led every technical decision for eight years. When Shortcut acquired us, the tech due diligence was smooth — that's a direct result of how Robert architected everything. I'd build with him again in a heartbeat.

Clients.title: Who I Work With

persona1.title: Serial Founders
persona1.desc: On your second or third venture. You've done this before and know what good looks like.

persona2.title: Corporate Escapees
persona2.desc: Left the big company to build something of your own. You know how to operate, now you need to build.

persona3.title: Scaling Teams
persona3.desc: Past the MVP stage. Your early architecture is showing cracks and you need someone who's scaled before.

Clients.not_for_desc: I don't do agencies, RFPs, or projects where I'm treated as a vendor. I work as a partner or not at all.

Contact.title: Let's Talk
Contact.p: I take on a handful of engagements at a time. If you're building something ambitious and want a technical partner who's been through it, let's have a conversation.
